prevent.title: 1. Masks
prevent.body: Masks help to prevent the spread of the corona virus from the person wearing the mask to others. Masks alone do not protect against COVID-19, and should be combined with physical distancing and hand hygiene. Follow the advice provided by your local health authority.

prevent.title: 2. Wash your hands often
prevent.body:
Wash your hands often with soap & water for at least 20 seconds especially after you have been in a public place, or even after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing. It’s especially important to wash:
 Before eating or preparing food 
 Before touching your face
 After using the restroom
 After leaving a public place
 After blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing
 After handling your mask
 After changing a diaper
 After caring for someone sick
 After touching animals or pets

prevent.title: 3. Avoid close contact
prevent.body:
Inside your home: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
1) If possible, maintain 2 meter between the person who is sick and other household members.
2) Outside your home: Put 2 meter of distance between yourself and people who don’t live in your household.
3) Remember that some people without symptoms may be able to spread virus.
4) Stay at least 2 meter from other people.
5) Keeping distance from others is especially important for people who are at higher risk of getting very sick.

prevent.title: 4. Cover coughs and sneezes
prevent.body:
Always cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze or use the inside of your elbow and do not spit. 
            1) Throw used tissues in the trash.
            2) Immediately wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not readily available, clean your hands with a hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.
